author: nadina.
title: Nunca hab\u00eda llovido tanto en octubre en Yvelines desde hac\u00eda m\u00e1s de un siglo
text: Par Julie Eslan Publicado el 1 de noviembre de 2024 a las 12:16 p.m. ver mis noticias Seguir 78actu La recurrencia y el vigor de mal tiempo de octubre de 2024 no se le han escapado a nadie. Y menos a√∫n en los radares de InfoClimat. La tormenta Kirk se desat√≥ especialmente en Yvelines entre el 9 y el 10 de octubre, provocando inundaciones, con particular intensidad en el sur del departamento. Los datos de precipitaciones del √∫ltimo mes han ca√≠do y varios registros fueron golpeados en el territorio. ‚Ä¢ Precipitaciones un 175% superiores a lo normal Septiembre de 2024 ya hab√≠a sido un mes r√©cord. Con estos 107,1 mm de lluvia ca√≠dos, el exceso de lluvia se midi√≥ en un +115% con respecto a la norma establecida durante el per√≠odo 1991/2020 (alrededor de 62 mm). Octubre de 2024 fue a√∫n m√°s lejos, con un diferencial del +175% y 169,4 mm de lluvia acumulada. El foto Se lleg√≥, sin mucha sorpresa, el mi√©rcoles 9 de octubre a la fecha del paso de Iglesia. En menos de veinticuatro horas cayeron 80 mm de agua sobre el departamento. S√≥lo el jueves 17 de octubre cayeron del cielo unos 32 mm m√°s. ‚Ä¢ El quinto mes m√°s lluvioso en el departamento desde‚Ä¶ 1918 Seg√∫n cifras de InfoClimat, octubre de 2024 ser√≠a el quinto mes m√°s lluvioso desde 1918 en Yvelines, detr√°s de agosto de 1931 (177,7 mm), diciembre de 1999 (178,4 mm), julio de 2001 (181 mm) y‚Ä¶ mayo de 2016 (193,7 mm). Ese a√±o, entre el s√°bado 28 de mayo y el martes 31 de mayo, el departamento (al igual que el vecino Eure-et-Loir) sufri√≥ importantes inundaciones. Sin embargo, el pico de precipitaciones en veinticuatro horas (66 mm el lunes 30 de mayo) fue de baja calidad a partir del 9 de octubre de 2024 (80 mm como recordatorio). ‚Ä¢ El mes de octubre ‚Äúm√°s h√∫medo‚Äù en la historia del territorio Seg√∫n las bases de datos de InfoClimat, no octubre desde 1918 S√≥lo hab√≠a sido tan lluvioso como el de 2024. El r√©cord anterior databa de 1981, con 163,5 mm de lluvia acumulada (tambi√©n 159 mm en 1998). Sigue todas las novedades de tus ciudades y medios favoritos suscribi√©ndote a Mon Actu.

author: Christopher Reynolds
title: WestJet pilots ask judge to nix approval of temporary foreign workers in the cockpit
text:
The union representing WestJet pilots is asking a judge to quash federal approval of temporary foreign workers in the cockpit. Amid a global flight crew shortage, the union representing WestJet pilots has asked a judge to quash federal approval of temporary foreign workers in the cockpit.
In an application it said was filed Monday, the Air Line Pilots Association petitioned the Federal Court to declare invalid a government decision allowing temporary work permits at regional subsidiary WestJet Encore earlier this month.
The airline requested about 60 permits for pilots from India and South Africa under the temporary foreign workers program, according to the filing.
Tim Perry, who heads the union's Canadian wing, said it was not consulted and that the move could erode "safety margins" and undercut wage gains.
"Airlines that do a good job with attraction and retention do not need to turn to temporary foreign workers," Perry said in a phone‚Ä¶
Christopher Reynolds

text:

Forensic scientists on the Blackfeet Reservation in Montana are specializing in solving Missing and Murdered Indigenous Peoples cases.

Anchorage police report 47 outdoor deaths this year, plus the Mat-Su Borough School District will no longer use remote learning days in place of weather-related closures and ASD could follow suit.
Updated: 18 hours ago
Updated: 18 hours ago
Hilltop Ski Area was able to remain open during a recent warm spell in Anchorage which saw temperatures nearing 50 degrees, and was able to retain most of the snow on the slopes, according to slope managers. Hilltop recently purchased new snow guns to aid in creating snow for their slopes, which General Manager Travis Bird says goes a long way in keeping the slopes covered even during warmer weather. The artificial snow is denser than natural making it more resilient.
Updated: 21 hours ago
The state‚Äôs Department of Transportation presented newly revised alternatives for the Seward to Glenn Connection during Tuesday‚Äôs open house.

author: dpa
title: Gewerkschaft verk√ºndet Tarifeinigung bei D√∂nerfabrik Birtat
text:
Mehrere Tage ist bei der schw√§bischen D√∂nerfabrik Birtat f√ºr bessere Bezahlung und einen Tarifvertrag gek√§mpft worden. Nun gibt es eine Einigung. Wie sieht sie aus?
Murr (dpa/lsw) - . Im Tarifkonflikt beim D√∂nerspie√ü-Hersteller Birtat gibt es eine Einigung - es ist zugleich nach Gewerkschaftsangaben der erste Tarifvertrag in der D√∂nerfleischindustrie. F√ºr die rund 120 Besch√§ftigten wurde der Einstiegslohn auf 2.600 Euro festgelegt, wie die Gewerkschaft Nahrung-Genuss-Gastst√§tten (NGG) und das Unternehmen Meat World SE (Birtat) in Murr bei Ludwigsburg gemeinsam mitteilten. Ferner sei eine Anhebung der Entgelte in zwei Stufen im Gesamtumfang von bis zu 17 Prozent in der Spitze bei einer Laufzeit bis Ende 2026 vereinbart worden. F√ºr eine direkte Stellungnahme war das Unternehmen zun√§chst nicht erreichbar.
Die Gewerkschaft NGG forderte eine Erh√∂hung der Entgelte um 375 Euro und einen Tarifvertrag. Bisher wurde die Arbeit an elf unterschiedlichen Tagen zeitweise niedergelegt. NGG-Verhandlungsf√ºhrerin Magdalena Kr√ºger sagte, dieser Tarifabschluss sei ein historisches Ergebnis in der D√∂nerfleischbranche und ein Erfolg der Besch√§ftigten. Cihan Karaman, der Pressesprecher der Meat World SE erkl√§rte laut der gemeinsamen Mitteilung: ‚ÄûWir sind √ºberzeugt, dass dieser Vertrag nicht nur Planungssicherheit schafft, sondern auch das Vertrauen und die Zusammenarbeit zwischen Unternehmen und Besch√§ftigten st√§rkt.‚Äú
Birtat geh√∂rt zur Meat World SE und ist der NGG zufolge der gr√∂√üte Hersteller von D√∂nerspie√üen in Baden-W√ºrttemberg - und einer der f√ºhrenden Anbieter in Deutschland. In der Fabrik stecken die Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter Fleisch vom Kalb, H√§hnchen oder Rind auf Spie√üe - und geben dem Ganzen die traditionelle Form. Die Spie√üe werden dann schockgefrostet und ausgeliefert.

author: AsiaNews.it
title: Pope pleads with leaders to stop escalation, commit to dialogue and negotiation'
text:
Pope pleads with leaders to stop escalation, commit to dialogue and negotiation'
Fresh Angelus appeal to rulers, for peace in Ukraine, Palestine, Israel and Myanmar. Dramatic humanitarian crisis in Sudan also recalled. On the Solemnity of Corpus Christi: Christians called to be "Eucharistic," to "make their lives a gift for others."
Vatican City (AsiaNews) - "I appeal to the wisdom of the rulers to cease the escalation and put every effort into dialogue and negotiation." Today, the Solemnity of Corpus Christi celebrated in Italy and other countries, a colorful expanse of open umbrellas to protect against the rain falling in these hours on Rome welcomed Pope Francis' words shared from the window of the Vatican Apostolic Palace starting at 12 noon during the Marian Angelus prayer. The pontiff asked not to forget the battered Ukraine, Palestine, Israel and Myanmar. The square was packed on the day of Italy's Republic Day, the date of the 1946 institutional referendum when women were first called to vote.
In the speech that followed the recitation of the Angelus, also a heartfelt remembrance of Sudan, "where the war that has lasted for over a year has not yet found a peaceful solution."
The clashes involve the army of General Abdel Fattah al-Burhane and the opposing paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF). Indeed, the North African country has been experiencing a very serious humanitarian crisis since April 2023, caused by the consequences of conflict and rampant famine.
The situation is causing a massive exodus of people to neighboring countries and safer areas with better conditions for living. UN figures speak of 18 million people suffering from hunger and an exorbitant number of boys and girls - suffering from malnutrition. "Let the guns be silent, and with the efforts of local authorities and the international community, help be brought to the people and the many displaced Sudanese refugees be allowed to find shelter and protection in neighboring countries," Pope Francis said.
The recitation of the Marian prayer was followed by a commentary on the day's Gospel (Mk 14:12-16, 22-26), which recounts Jesus' Last Supper. Inherent in this famous episode is a "gesture of delivery." "In fact, in the bread broken and in the cup offered to the disciples, it is He Himself who gives Himself for all humanity," Bergoglio said.
"And He offers Himself for the life of the world. The Holy Father then stressed an "important aspect" of this passage: the words "he gave him to them" (v. 22). The Eucharist "recalls first of all the dimension of gift," he added, in that Jesus does not divide the bread to eat it alone, but to share it. "Of his whole life Jesus made a gift."
From these premises Francis shared a reflection on the celebration of the Eucharist as experienced by Christian people every Sunday. "Celebrating the Eucharist and feeding on this Bread, as we do especially on Sundays, is not an act of worship detached from life or a simple moment of personal consolation," he said.
Then recalling St. Leo the Great, according to whom participating in the body and blood of Christ serves to "make us become what we eat" (Sermon XII on the Passion, 7), the Pontiff added that Christians are called "to become eucharistic, that is, people who no longer live for themselves, no, in the logic of possession and consumption, no. People who know how to make of their lives a gift for others, yes!" Thanks to the Eucharist we become "prophets and builders of a new world: when we overcome selfishness and open ourselves to love, when we cultivate bonds of fraternity, when we participate in the sufferings of our brothers and sisters and share bread and resources with those in need."
Finally, Pope Francis provoked those listening with some questions, "Do I keep my life only for myself or do I give it as Jesus did? Do I spend myself for others or am I closed in my little self? And, in everyday situations, do I know how to share or do I always seek my own interest?"

author: @TIMESNOW
title: Why This Classic Book Should Be Required Reading for Everyone Feeling Lost in Their 20s
text:
Books
summary
Why This Classic Book Should Be Required Reading for Everyone Feeling Lost in Their 20s
'Demian' by Hermann Hesse follows Emil Sinclair‚Äôs journey through confusion, identity crises, and spiritual awakening. Guided by the enigmatic Demian, Sinclair navigates the grey areas of morality and selfhood. This introspective novel resonates deeply with anyone in their twenties grappling with who they are and where they‚Äôre headed.
Why This Classic Book Should Be Required Reading for Everyone Feeling Lost in Their 20s (Picture Credit - Instagram)
When you‚Äôre 20-something, the world feels like a blur. You‚Äôre told to chase success, but no one hands you a compass. That‚Äôs where '
Demian' by Hermann Hessecomes in. A story that feels like it‚Äôs speaking directly to the soul of a generation unsure of who they are.
The Novel That Understands You Before You Understand Yourself
'Demian', first published in 1919, isn‚Äôt just a coming-of-age novel ‚Äî it‚Äôs a philosophical mirror. Through the character of Emil Sinclair, Hesse captures the intense confusion and search for identity that defines the early twenties. Sinclair, like many of us, lives in two worlds: one clean and orderly, the other dark and real. His journey to merge these worlds reflects the emotional turbulence of youth.
In your twenties, you start to realise that life isn‚Äôt binary. Right and wrong blur. Career paths twist. Friendships shift. Sinclair‚Äôs internal struggle feels deeply personal. When he meets the mysterious Demian ‚Äî a character who challenges everything he knows, it‚Äôs like that moment you meet someone who cracks open your thinking and makes you question what you‚Äôve accepted blindly.
Demian Doesn‚Äôt Offer Answers, But It Gives You Permission to Ask
One of the most powerful things about Demian is that it never pretends to give you a roadmap. It doesn‚Äôt tell you who you should be. Instead, it encourages you to start asking the real questions:
What if everything I believed was someone else‚Äôs idea of the truth?
What if being lost is actually the first step to finding something deeper?
In your twenties, you‚Äôre bombarded with expectations ‚Äî from parents, society, even your Instagram feed. Hesse‚Äôs novel whispers, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay to walk away from all of it.‚Äù That‚Äôs not an easy message to hear, but it‚Äôs the one many need, especially when you‚Äôre stuck between what the world wants from you and what your gut is quietly trying to say.
A Spiritual Wake-Up Call for the Sceptical
While the novel dives into religion, mysticism, and symbols like Abraxas ‚Äî a god that embodies both good and evil, it isn‚Äôt preachy. Instead, it forces you to look inward. Hesse was heavily influenced by
Carl Jung, and 'Demian' often feels like a psychological excavation. It gets under your skin, but gently.
For someone in their twenties, who‚Äôs becoming painfully aware that the answers aren‚Äôt in textbooks or motivational podcasts, this novel says: the search is the answer.
The Feeling of Finding a Book That Feels Like a Friend
We‚Äôve all had those nights ‚Äî lying awake, wondering if we‚Äôre doing life wrong. Sinclair‚Äôs loneliness, confusion, and inner conflict will resonate with anyone who‚Äôs ever felt disconnected in a crowded room or unsure while achieving what they‚Äôre ‚Äúsupposed‚Äù to want. Hesse doesn‚Äôt romanticise pain, but he honours it.
Reading 'Demian' feels like finally sitting with someone who doesn‚Äôt try to fix you. Who simply says, ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been there too.‚Äù
Why It Still Matters Over a Century Later
It‚Äôs easy to think that a novel written in 1919 couldn‚Äôt possibly relate to your modern problems. But 'Demian' transcends time. The battle between conformity and individuality, the search for purpose, the ache of self-discovery ‚Äî they‚Äôre timeless themes. Today‚Äôs twenty-somethings may express their crisis through
TikToktrends or burnout memes, but the soul-questions remain the same.
Hesse reminds us that the pain of becoming isn‚Äôt new, but it‚Äôs always meaningful.
If you‚Äôre in your twenties and feel like you‚Äôre drowning in choices, doubt, or quiet despair, Demian won‚Äôt hand you a life plan. What it will do is awaken something in you ‚Äî a kind of quiet knowing that maybe, just maybe, feeling lost isn‚Äôt the problem. Maybe it‚Äôs the beginning of becoming.
This book isn‚Äôt for the faint-hearted. But if you‚Äôre ready to see yourself honestly, confront your contradictions, and start walking your own path, 'Demian' is the guide you didn‚Äôt know you needed.
Girish Shukla author
A dedicated bibliophile with a love for psychology and mythology, I am the author of two captivating novels. I craft stories that delve into the intri...

author: VNExplorer
title: Christmas Eve weather: Severe thunderstorms forecast for parts of Australia - what the conditions look like in Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne
text:
Severe thunderstorms forecast for Christmas EveNSW, Queensland and Victoria in firing line
NSW, Queensland and Victoria could face severe thunderstorms on Christmas Eve with residents told to prepare for the potential for hail, flash flooding and heavy rains.
Major storm concerns are held for ‚Äòthe vast majority of NSW‚Äô and Queensland, stretching all the way from Mackay to the state‚Äôs south east.
The Bureau of Meteorology‚Äôs senior meteorologist Angus Hines said the activity was forecast to peak on Sunday afternoon.
‚ÄòThe particular area where we‚Äôre likely to see severe thunderstorms is around Southeast Queensland including the Brisbane region and northeast NSW,‚Äô he said.
‚ÄòWe could see some of those thunderstorms get really big, really intense and they could potentially cause damaging to destructive wind gusts heavy to locally intense rainfall and large or even the giant sized hail as we saw yesterday.‚Äô
An outbreak of thunderstorms will affect many areas around NSW & Qld today -some of these thunderstorms may be severe. A low pressure system developing Christmas Eve near the Vic/NSW border will drag the storm risk sth across much of #Vic Xmas Day. Latest: https://t.co/4W35o8i7wJ pic.twitter.com/q9UioJ4xYh
‚Äî Bureau of Meteorology, Australia (@BOM_au) December 23, 2023
NSW, Queensland and Victoria could face severe thunderstorms on Christmas Eve with residents told to prepare for the potential for hail, flash flooding and heavy rains
On Sunday morning, BOM issued a severe thunderstorm warning for parts of central Queensland, with the potential for damaging wind, heavy rainfall and large hail.
This follows a spate of severe storms on Saturday, with high temperatures fuelling the weather activity.
The current warning is for areas across the southern Darling Downs, and Granite Belt district, however the weather authority said the activity will likely move eastwards in over the next few hours.
In NSW, showers and severe thunderstorms will mainly occur in the central and eastern inland areas, with lighter storms forecast near the coast and far west.
Up to 30mm of rain is forecast for Sydney on Sunday, with the chance for showers easing into the night.
üå©Ô∏è#SevereThunderstorms have developed over the southern #DarlingDowns & Granite Belt district. Large hail, damaging winds & heavy rainfall are possible. Activity is likely move east over the next few hours. Updates: https://t.co/G5LAzkEaQ1 pic.twitter.com/9V8di5ic3D
‚Äî Bureau of Meteorology, Queensland (@BOM_Qld) December 23, 2023
Massive storms are forecast for Christmas Eve with the grim weather a departure from the characteristic, end-of-year heatwave
The Bureau warned a low pressure system developing on the NSW/ Victoria border will drag the storm risk ‚Äòacross much of Victoria‚Äô on Christmas Eve, bringing wet weather as the day progresses
Melbourne‚Äôs Carols by Candlelight also faces a potential washout, with a high chance of showers, and a possible thunderstorm forecast for the late afternoon and evening. The outdoors event will begin at the Sidney Myer Music Bowl from 8pm, with organisers adamant the show will go on rain, hail or shine.
The Bureau warned a low pressure system developing on the NSW/ Victoria border will drag the storm risk ‚Äòacross much of Victoria‚Äô on Christmas Eve, bringing wet weather as the day progresses.
‚ÄòShowers of course, by their nature, tend to be a little spotty a little hit and miss ‚Äì so there‚Äôs still a chance we‚Äôll get the carols in the dry but there‚Äôs a risk of showers across Melbourne City at that time of day,‚Äô said Mr Hines.While the eastern states could face a wet Christmas, multiple severe heatwave warnings remain in place for Western Australia.
The Bureau have issued a warning for the Pilbara, Gascoyne, North Interior and South Interior Districts, where temperatures could reach up to 45C.
The alert is currently in place until Boxing Day.
